title: **>>>Cell culture<<<**
body:
HEK293 cells were cultured in DMEM medium supplemented with 5% heat-inactivated FBS at 37°C under humidified air containing 5% CO2.

body.body: Coat 35-mm glass bottom dish with 0.01% \(w/v) poly-lysine, rock gently to ensure even coating of the culture surface
After 5 min, remove poly-lysine by aspiration
Rinse surface with sterile tissue culture grade water 5 times, and remove water
Dry the plate at 60°C for one hour
Seed HEK293 cells \(2×10<sup>5</sup> cells) at pre-coated 35-mm glass bottom dish and culture for one day
Transfect GFP-STIM1-APEX2 using Lipofactamine 3000 \(500 ng plasmid) following the manufacturer’s instructions \(Life technologies)

title: **>>>Enrichment of biotinylated proteins, silver staining and Western blotting<<<**
**a)**
body: Coat plate with poly-L-Lysine as described above

body.body: Seed HEK293 cells on pre-coated 10-cm plates and culture for one day
Transfect GFP-STIM1-APEX2 \(5 μg) using lipofactamine 3000
24 h posttransfection, add biotin-phenol \(at a final concentration of 0.5 mM) to the culture medium for 30min at 37 °C; Note 2
Add biotin-phenol and H<sub>2</sub>O<sub>2</sub> as described above
After 1 min of labeling, wash cells immediately with the quencher solution five times; 10 ml per wash

title: **Note 2**
body:
: To capture protein complexes surrounding STIM1 after store depletion, replace DMEM medium with Ca<sup>2+</sup>-free HBBS solution and then treat cells in 1 μM TG for 5 min to trigger store depletion 





_For steps 6-13, all the steps should be operated at 4 °C and the samples should be kept on ice to reduce protein degradation_

body.body: Scrap cells from culture dish and centrifuge at 5,000 ×g for 15 min
Lyse cells with RIPA buffer supplemented with 1×protease inhibitor cocktail, and centrifuge at 12,000 ×g for 10 min to remove insoluble debris
Pack NeutrAvidin Agarose Resin into a 1.5 ml tube and wash with RIPA buffer, centrifuge at 2,000 ×g for 1 min to remove storage solution, repeat wash step twice
Equilibrate resin with RIPA buffer for 30 min and shake gently
Centrifuge at 2,000 ×g for 1 min to remove buffer
Incubate cell lysates with resin \(8 mg of biotinylated protein/ml of settled resin) and gently rotate the mixture for 4-6 h to enrich biotinylated proteins
Rinse beads with 1 ml PBS supplemented with 1×protease inhibitor cocktail, centrifuge at 2,000 ×g and remove buffer
Repeat wash step for ten times to remove unbounded proteins, discard wash buffer
Boil resin with LDS sample buffer

Separate proteins by 4-12% Bis-Tris protein gels 
  Optional: elute enriched proteins from beads using elution buffer \(8 M urea, pH1.5)
Stain SDS-PAGE using the Silver Stain Kit; Note 3
Excise desired bands for further mass spectrometry analysis \(in-gel digestion)
Another SDS-PAGE resolving the same samples is subjected to western blotting to detect biotinylated proteins by streptavidin-HRP \(1:4000)

title: **Note 3**
body: : for the silver staining, ultrapure water is used for buffer preparation and gel washing. Use clean gloves to reduce contamination. Scalpel should be changed after excising each gel slice to reduce cross-sample contamination.

title: **d)**
body:
Elution of biotinylated proteins for in-solution digestion


After step 13, enriched biotinylated proteins can also be eluted and precipitated by acetone for mass spectrometry

body.body: Elute biotinylated proteins using 2 resin volumes of elution buffer \(8 M urea, pH 1.5)
Centrifuge at 2,000 ×g for 1 min and collect the supernatant to a new clean 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube
Repeat steps 14-15 and collect the elution proteins into one tube
Add 6× volume of acetone that is pre-cooled at -20 ºC
Mix well and keep at -20 ºC for 30 min to overnight
Spin in a refrigerated microfuge at top speed for 30 min
Aspirate most of the supernatant and leave the last drop so as not to disturb the pellet
Wash the pellet with 500 μl cold \(-20 ºC) acetone twice

Air-dry the pellet \(no speed vac; over-dried samples are hard to dissolve).
  


HEK293 cells without transfection of GFP-STIM1-APEX2 or omitting the addition of the substrate biotin-phenol but treated with H<sub>2</sub>O<sub>2</sub> were used throughout the procedures as negative controls.

title: **>>> In-gel or in-solution protein digestion and liquid chromatography tandem-mass spectrometry \(LC-MS/MS) <<<**

body.body: Cut the gel slices to approximately 1 mm3 pieces
Destain with 0.1 ml ProteoSilver Destainer A and 0.1 ml ProteoSilver Destainer B \(ProteoSilver Plus Silver Stain Kit)
Wash with 500 μl 50 mM NH<sub>4</sub>HCO<sub>3</sub> for 20 min. Discard the washing buffer
Add 150 μl of 50 mM NH<sub>4</sub>HCO<sub>3</sub> and 0.5 μl 1 M TCEP. Incubate at 60 ºC for 15 min
Cool to RT and add 2 μl 500 mM IAA and incubate for 15 min in the dark at RT. Discard the solvent
Add 1 ml of acetonitrile to shrink the gel pieces. After 10-15 min, remove the solvent \(and dry the gel slices in the speed vac).

Reswell the gel pieces with 20 μl Promega modified trypsin \(sequencing grade) at a concentration of 5 ng/μl in 25 mM NH<sub>4</sub>HCO<sub>3</sub>. After 10-15 min, add 10-20 μl of additional buffer to cover the gel slices. Incubate overnight at 37 ºC.
Remove the supernatant and place in new tubes.
Extract remaining peptides from gel with 50 μl extract buffer I \(50% Acetonitrile/5% Formic acid) for 30 min in a thermomixer \(700 rpm).
Extract remaining peptides from gel with 50 μl extract buffer II \(75% Acetonitrile/0.1% FA) for 30 minutes in a thermomixer at \(700 rpm).
Combine the supernatant and two extracts and speed vac to dryness.
Resuspend peptides with 20 μl 0.1% formic acid.
Dissolve proteins in 8 M urea, 100 mM Tris pH 8.5 \(10 ul). Sonicate for 10 min
Add TCEP to a final conc. of 5 mM and incubate at RT for 20 min
Add IAA to a final concentration of 10 mM; incubate at RT for 15 min in the dark
Dilute samples by a factor of 4 with 100 mM Tris-HCl pH 8.5
Add CaCl<sub>2</sub> to a final concentration of 1 mM
Add methylamine to 20 mM to reduce carbamylation
Add in trypsin with the enzyme:substrate ratio of 1:50
Incubate at 37 ºC O/N in the dark
Add formic acid to 4~5% \(final concentration)
Centrifuge at 18,000 xg for 30 min, and save the supernatant for LC-MS/MS.

title: **c)**
body:
LC-MS/MS


LC-MS/MS analyses of the in-gel or in-solution digested samples were performed on a Q Exactive Orbitrap mass spectrometer coupled to an Easy-nLC 1000 HPLC. Peptides were loaded on a pre-column \(75 mm ID, 8 cm long, packed with ODS-AQ 120 Å, 10 mm reversed-phase beads from YMC Inc.) and separated on an analytical column \(75 mm ID, 11 cm long, packed with Luna C18 100 Å, 1.8 mm resin from Welch Materials) with an acetonitrile gradient from 0–28% in 55 min and 28-80% in another 6 min \(with 0.1% FA in the mobile phase from beginning to end) at a flow rate of 200 nl/min. The top 15 most intense precursor ions from each full scan \(resolution 70,000) were isolated for HCD MS2 \(resolution 17,500; Normalized collision energy

body.body: with a dynamic exclusion time of 20 s. Precursor ions of a 1+, > 6+ or unassigned charge state were excluded.

title: **d)**
body:
Peptide identification


The MS2 spectra were searched against the Uniprot-human database \(forward and reversed sequences) using ProLucid \(12) with mass accuracy for precursor and fragment ions both set at 50 ppm and carbamidomethylation on cysteine as fixed modification. The ProLuCID search results were filtered using DTASelect 2.0 \(13) with 10 ppm mass accuracy for precursor mass and a 1% FDR cutoff at the spectral level. At least two peptides were required to identify a protein and the protein-level FDR is <1%. Positive hits were primarily selected by three stringent criteria: first, for each candidate protein, at least two peptides were detected in LC-MS/MS; second, hits detected in our two control groups were discarded; third, the candidate proteins must be detected in at least two out of four repeated experiments.
